Journal.Title: The British journal of general practice : the journal of the Royal College of General Practitioners

Article.ArticleTitle: Learning from long COVID: integrated care for multiple long-term conditions.

AffiliationInfo.Affiliation: Department of Health Sciences, Hull York Medical School, University of York, York; Honorary Professor, Institute of Health Informatics, University College London, London.
Royal College of General Practitioners, London; Associate Professor, Division of Primary Care, University of Nottingham, Nottingham.

MedlineCitation.CoiStatement: Christina van der Feltz-Cornelis received travel and accommodation in the UK for a lecture from The Lloyd’s Register Foundation, and travel and accommodation in the UK and an honorarium payment related to a lecture at the Big Questions in Neuroscience Annual Meeting from Janssen UK. She received funding from the NIHR for four projects, of which STIMULATE-ICP is one; the British Medical Association; the EU Horizon Programme; and the Netherlands Organisation for Health Research and Development. All co-authors received NIHR funding for the STIMULATE-ICP study. Mel Heightman is National Specialty Advisor for Long COVID, NHS England. Gail Allsopp is Medical Director Clinical Policy at the Royal College of General Practitioners.

Reference.Citation: NHS England . National commissioning guidance for post COVID services. London: NHS England; 2022.

van der Feltz-Cornelis CM, Sweetman J, Allsopp G, et al. STIMULATE-ICP-Delphi (Symptoms, Trajectory, Inequalities and Management: Understanding Long-COVID to Address and Transform Existing Integrated Care Pathways Delphi): study protocol. PLoS One. 2022;17(11):e0277936.
